result.execSummary:
The defendant Mariah C Delarosa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
COUNTS 1 & 3:  Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: consecutive to Count #2 and Count #3. 
Credit for 35 days time served.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
consecutive to Count #1 and Count #3. 
Credit for ZERO days time served.

Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 6 months.
Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations AND defendant has no new violations of law.

Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Complete a parenting class.
Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to Count #1 and Count #2. 
Credit for ZERO days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah C Delarosa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mariah C Delarosa
Current: 1721 S. 19th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204-3126 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 4567 North 48th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count #2 and Count #3. 
Credit for 35 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count #1 and Count #3. 
Credit for ZERO days time served. 
COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 30 months.

AS TO COUNT 3 (MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to Count #1 and Count #2. 
Credit for ZERO days time served.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 2): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* Complete a parenting class.
* Complete a cognitive behavior therapy program.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 6 months.
* Defendant is not to operate any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
**Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations AND defendant has no new violations of law.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to two misdemeanors as follows:  

Count #1:  Child Neglect [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a).  
Count #3:  Child Neglect [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a).

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3 (MISDEMEANORS):      Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

filed by ADA Francesco Mineo on behalf of the State.  Count #1 is AMENDED to:  Child Neglect [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a).  Also, ADD Count #3:  Child Neglect [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 948.21(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a).

Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) No contact with the victims.  (2) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (3) Submit to random urine screens.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Mariah C Delarosa not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Upon stipulation of the parties, Court MODIFIED bail to $500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) No contact with the victims.  (2) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (3) Submit to random urine screens.

Case adjourned to 06-23-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in custody.  Ronald Dague for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mariah C Delarosa in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
